clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Passive Smoking on Children During Gastrointestinal Endoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Passive Smoking on Children During Gastrointestinal Endoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the effect of passive smoking in children during Gastrointestinal Endoscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: When the patients and their parents are arrived in the endoscopy unıt about 1 h before the procedure, the anesthetist is obtained a medical history and carried out a physical examination and clinical assesment. Then the parents smoking habits are documented about to detect the magnitude of passive smoking. Endoscopist and anesthesiologist are blinded to the patients passive smoking history. Then the sedation is applied and esophagogastroduodenoscopy procedures performed. Side effects (e.g laryngospasm, coughing) during the study are recorded.

primary_outcome.description: The prevalence of laryngospasm in sedation applied to endoscopic intervention whose parents smoking.

secondary_outcome.description: The prevalence of hypoxia (oxygen saturation < % 90) in sedation applied to endoscopic intervention whose parents smoking.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Effects of passive smoking on children
arm_group.description: The prevalence of laryngospasm in sedation applied to endoscopic intervention whose parents smoking.

intervention.description: The prevalence of laryngospasm in sedation applied to endoscopic intervention whose parents no smoking.
intervention.arm_group_label: Effects of passive smoking on children

study_pop.textblock: Esophagogastroduodenoscopy patients are included in the study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA ( American Society of Anesthesiologists) I- ASA II patients
- Aged 1- 18 Year old patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smoker patients
